basics.name: Emily Zhao
basics.summary: I'm excited by executing cool ideas for a better tomorrow. Leveraging a robust technical background, the strong ability to quickly learn and adapt, and a proven track record in program execution-- I excel at transforming ideas into actionable solutions and leading teams to deliver impactful results.

education.area: Electrical and Computer Engineering, Computer Science

work.name: Cardiac Rhythm Management, Medtronic
highlights: Designed Python-based Universal Core Longevity Estimator algorithm for next-gen implantable cardiac devices, reducing development time by 12 months, standardizing cross-device performance, and reducing field error occurrences.
Automated data analysis and visualization of device current testing and documentation, significantly improving process efficiency.
Troubleshoot software for automated testing scripts to improve hardware characterization processes.

work.name: Cardiac Rhythm Management, Medtronic
highlights: Conducted bench testing and data analysis of Bluetooth field data from Medtronicâ€™s Patient Programmer to profile the noise interference in operating rooms, developed an algorithm to simulate and predict Bluetooth data throughput with Wi-Fi coexistence, to help redefine signal transmission protocol for greater reliability.

work.name: Summer Orchestra Program, Mounds View Public Schools
highlights: Led private lessons, sectionals, and group lessons for 4th-6th grade students learning violin, viola, cello, and bass.

Coordinate a STEM hackathon for 100+ high school students, teaching Python & AI, data visualization, game development, and cybersecurity workshops, while connecting participants with professionals on careers in tech.
Lead the redesign and strategic expansion of Duke Conversations, advancing our mission to connect faculty and students through weekly intimate dinner discussions with administration and professors.

awards.title: Cyber 9/12 Strategy Challenge National Champion
awards.summary: 1st of 24 teams from across the country, including West Point Military Academy, Stanford, Air Command and Staff College, etc.
